intro: Alchemilla fissa subsp. major, commonly known as the broad-leaved lady’s mantle, is a perennial herb native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers in summer, which are borne on slender pedicels. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its astringent properties.
